comments.body: While not really part of the openblas handling, this will disable all the fancy "copy to tmp directory, exec(setup.py)" things that pip now does when calling `pip wheel`. The former slows things down, the latter breaks our setup.py (it cannot find `parse_setuppy_commands`)
If I recall correctly, this was added to test that numpy will still load properly even if there are two fortran dlls in the .lib directory on windows. The real test is in the next step

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +49,53 @@- bash: |
    pushd . && cd .. && target=$(python -c "import numpy, os; print(os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(numpy.__file__), '.libs')))") && popd
    pip download -d destination --only-binary :all: --no-deps numpy==1.14
    cd destination && unzip numpy*.whl && cp numpy/.libs/*.dll $target
    ls $target

comments.body: The need to add OPENBLAS_SUFFIX (line 20, 21) seems to me to be a bug in the packaging of the openblas-lib. It knows about 64bit builds, and should package the library appropriately.
